dublin_core.dcvalue: The steady progress of microelectronics communications and information technology will enable the realisation of the vision for ubiquitous computing where the Internet extends into the real world embracing everyday objects The necessary technical basis is already in place Due to their diminishing size constantly falling price and declining energy consumption processors communications modules and sensors are being increasingly integrated into everyday objects today This development is opening up huge opportunities for both the economy and individuals In the present paper we discuss possible applications but also technical social and economic barriers to a wide spread use of ubiquitous computing in the health care sector
Zeitschrift für Evidenz, Fortbildung und Qualität im Gesundheitswesen
[Facing the challenges of ubiquitous computing in the health care sector].
